chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronny A. Copeland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting/Failing to Stop [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two.
Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

AODA and follow through. 

DNA sample.
MCJ applies to Ct.1 only, all other conditions the same

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronny A. Copeland

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases called at 8:39 am.
INCLUDES: 21CF900 21CF1534 21CT318 & 22CF41.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears from MCJ, and by Attorney Trevor Peterson. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

Court notes Preliminary Hearing was not completed in 21CF900; Defendant agrees to Waive Prelim.  
Waiver of Prelim to be filed.  
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  R/W; R/J. 

State moves to: 
21CF900 --
Ct.2(Possess Drug Paraphernailia/Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct.3(Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)/Repeater)>>DRI.

21CF1534 --
Ct.1(Felony BJ/Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)/Repeater)>>DRI.

21CT318 --
Ct.1(Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs))>>DRI.

22CF41 --
Ct.3(Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)/Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct.4(Misd.BJ/Repeater)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
21CF900 --
Ct.1(Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>GUILTY.

22CF41 --
Ct.1(Felony BJ/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
Ct.2(Resisting/Failing to Stop/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct.1 in 21CF900>>SWH for 3 years probation, to run CONCURRENT to each other; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. AODA and follow through. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two. Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances. Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 
Court grants 3 days credit.

Ct.1 in 22CF41>>SWH for 3 years probation, to run CONCURRENT to each other; CONDITIONS: Serve 90 days MCJ, no objection to EMP.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. AODA and follow through. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two. Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances. Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 
Court grants 55 days credit.

Ct.2 in 22CF41>>SWH for 1 year probation, to run CONCURRENT to each other; CONDITIONS:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. AODA and follow through. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two. Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances. Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

Court DENIES furlough request. 

Adj: 8:59 am.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Includes cases 21CF1534 & 22CF41. No driving without a valid DL. Prints and photograph. Report to ATTIC Correctional Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.
Cased called at 
INCLUDES: 21CF1534 & 22CF41. 
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears from MCJ, and by Attorney Trevor Peterson. 

Date and Time set for Bond Modification Hearing.  VRCW.

Defense is requesting a signature bond. 
Attorney Peterson recites current cash bond covering new files. 
Court notes defendant's open files are not cross-referenced. 
State objects to any bond amendment and makes argument. 
Attorney Peterson makes argument.  Defendant makes statement. 

COURT AMENDS BOND: 
$1,000 cash bond to cover both cases, with the same conditions. 

New dates to be scheduled with JA. 

Adj: 2:29 pm.
